related_questions.question: How do I change the background in Zoom?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Open the Zoom desktop client.
Click on your profile picture, then click "Settings".
Select "Background & Filters" on the left sidebar.
Choose a background from the available options or upload your own by clicking the "+" button.¬†
Join or start a Zoom meeting.
Click the up arrow next to "Stop Video" and select "Choose Virtual Background".
Select your desired background or upload a new one.¬†

related_questions.question: How do I change the Zoom background without joining a meeting?
related_questions.title: Change your virtual background outside of a meeting (iOS only)
list: Sign in to the Zoom mobile app for iOS.
In the bottom-right corner, tap More.
Under Settings, tap Meetings.
Under Video, tap Background & effects.

related_questions.question: How do you change the background on Zoom rooms?
related_questions.title: How to enable Virtual Background for Zoom Rooms during a meeting
list: While in a meeting, tap the settings gear icon on your Zoom Room controller.
Tap Virtual Background and then tap the background you would like. ...
(Optional) Tap Recalibrate to automatically adjust the virtual background.

related_questions.question: How do you make a custom Zoom background?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Image: You can use any image editor like Fotor, VistaCreate, or even Canva to create or customize an image.¬†
Video: You can use video editing software to create a short video loop or find royalty-free video clips.¬†
Aspect Ratio: Zoom recommends a 16:9 aspect ratio for backgrounds.¬†
Dimensions: A minimum resolution of 1280x720 pixels is recommended for images, and 480x360 pixels for videos.¬†
File Type: Zoom supports PNG or JPG/JPEG for images, and MP4 or MOV for videos.¬†
Desktop Client: Open the Zoom desktop client, click your profile picture, then "Settings".¬†
Web Portal: Log into your Zoom web portal, navigate to "My Account," and then "Settings".¬†
Virtual Background: In settings, find "Background & Filters" (or "Virtual Background") and enable the feature.¬†
Desktop Client: Click the "+" button next to "Choose Virtual Background" and upload your image or video file.¬†
Web Portal: Click the "+" button under "Virtual Backgrounds" to upload your file.¬†
Mirror Video: If your background appears flipped, you may need to enable the "Mirror my video" option in settings.¬†
Green Screen: If you have a green screen, you can enable the "I have a green screen" option in settings for a more seamless effect.¬†
Test: Before your meeting, test your background to ensure it's displaying correctly.¬†
Professionalism: Choose backgrounds that are appropriate for your meeting's context and maintain a professional image.¬†

text_blocks.snippet: To change your background in Zoom, you can use the virtual background feature. For desktop, open the Zoom client, go to Settings > Background & Filters, and select a pre-existing background or upload your own. On mobile, during a meeting, tap the three dots for "More", then "Virtual Background", and choose or upload an image.
snippet_highlighted_words: open the Zoom client, go to Settings > Background & Filters, and select a pre-existing background or upload your own

list.snippet: Open Zoom: Launch the Zoom desktop application.
Access Settings: Click on your profile picture and then select "Settings".
Go to Background & Filters: In the settings menu, navigate to "Background & Filters" on the left sidebar.
Choose or Upload: Select from the provided default backgrounds or click the "+" button to upload your own image or video.
Start or Join a Meeting: Join or start a Zoom meeting.
Access More Options: Tap the three dots at the bottom right of the screen to open the "More" menu.
Choose or Upload: Select from the default options or upload your own image or video.
Green Screen: If you have a physical green screen, you can enable the "I have a green screen" option in settings and select the correct color.
Troubleshooting: If you're having trouble, try updating your Zoom client, logging out and back in, or submitting a support ticket.
Image/Video Formats: Zoom supports JPG, PNG, MP4, and MOV files for backgrounds.
